title: Binley Woods Walks

images.title: Stephen McKay / Woodlands Road, Binley Woods
images.caption: Woodlands Road. Binley Woods was first developed with rather makeshift wooden bungalows in the inter-war years on what was then referred to as Binley Common, outside Binley village. The name Binley Woods was not adopted until the 1960s; the area is now an extensive estate, effectively a suburb of Coventry but politically within Rugby Borough. This is the southernmost point looking back along Woodlands Road towards Rugby Road as the snow of the previous week is gradually disappearing.

images.title: E Gammie / Goose Pool and reeds, Brandon Marsh
images.caption: Goose Pool and reeds, Brandon Marsh. Poplars were often used to disguise industrial works and several remain around this pool.

images.title: E Gammie / Central Marsh Pool, Brandon Marsh
images.caption: Central Marsh Pool, Brandon Marsh

description: This fairly modern suburban village is located close to Coventry and Rugby in the county of Warwickshire. For walkers there are a number of country parks, nature reserves and woodland areas within walking distance of the village. This walk from Binley Woods visits two of the local walking highlights at Brandon Woods and Brandon Marsh Nature Reserve. You can start the walk in the village centre and then head south east to the entrance to the woods. Follow the paths south and then west and you will come out of the woods near the railway crossing. Head south and then cross Brandon Lane and it will take you into the nature reserve. Here you'll find a series of lakes with lots of bird life to look out for. To continue your walking around the village head north along the Warwickshire Centenary Way to Coombe Country Park . There's a lovely large lake with a waterside footpath to try here.
